solution_line_template: The number of non-valuable files Brennan downloaded in the first round is {deleted_percentage_first_round}*{initial_download_files} = <<{deleted_percentage_first_round}*{initial_download_files}={non_valuable_files_first_round}>>{non_valuable_files_first_round} files.

The number of valuable files Brennan downloaded in the first round is {initial_download_files}-{non_valuable_files_first_round} = <<{initial_download_files}-{non_valuable_files_first_round}={valuable_files_first_round}>>{valuable_files_first_round}

When he downloaded {second_download_files} new files, there were {irrelevant_fraction_second_round}*{second_download_files}= <<{irrelevant_fraction_second_round}*{second_download_files}={non_useful_files_second_round}>>{non_useful_files_second_round} non-useful files, which he deleted again.

The total number of valuable files he downloaded in the second round is {second_download_files}-{non_useful_files_second_round} = <<{second_download_files}-{non_useful_files_second_round}={valuable_files_second_round}>>{valuable_files_second_round}

To write his research, Brennan had {valuable_files_second_round}+{valuable_files_first_round} = <<{valuable_files_second_round}+{valuable_files_first_round}={total_valuable_files}>>{total_valuable_files} useful files to reference to write his research.
